intro: Alectorolophus pseudofreynii, commonly known as the African vulture's milkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweed species known for their milky sap. The plant produces showy, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. Its leaves are opposite and often have a hairy texture. It thrives in dry, open habitats and is adapted to arid conditions.
